timeline.message:
Create and Display Developer Menu View (#606)

* created activity to display dev menu from context and updated package name

* start the developer menu activity and display developer menu on bottom of screen

* changed styling of dev menu to overlay current view

* updated copyright year

Display Developer Menu only in Debug Build (#617)

* created activity to display dev menu from context and updated package name

* start the developer menu activity and display developer menu on bottom of screen

* changed styling of dev menu to overlay current view

* updated copyright year

* only display dev menu if in debug mode
Merge branch 'main' into DevMenu

Show and hide dev menu on device shake or keyboard shortcut (#622)

* created activity to display dev menu from context and updated package name

* start the developer menu activity and display developer menu on bottom of screen

* changed styling of dev menu to overlay current view

* updated copyright year

* only display dev menu if in debug mode

* activate dev menu on device shake or keyboard shortcut

* adjusted shake threshold

* reordered fields in DeveloperMenuActivity

* factor shake detection logic out into separate class

Add buttons to main screen of developer menu (#626)

* created activity to display dev menu from context and updated package name

* start the developer menu activity and display developer menu on bottom of screen

* changed styling of dev menu to overlay current view

* updated copyright year

* only display dev menu if in debug mode

* activate dev menu on device shake or keyboard shortcut

* adjusted shake threshold

* reordered fields in DeveloperMenuActivity

* factor shake detection logic out into separate class

* added buttons to dev menu and did basic styling

* changed XML IDs from camel case to lower snake case

Move shake detection logic into ShakeDetector and add unit tests for ShakeDetector (#630)

* created activity to display dev menu from context and updated package name

* start the developer menu activity and display developer menu on bottom of screen

* changed styling of dev menu to overlay current view

* updated copyright year

* only display dev menu if in debug mode

* activate dev menu on device shake or keyboard shortcut

* adjusted shake threshold

* reordered fields in DeveloperMenuActivity

* factor shake detection logic out into separate class

* added buttons to dev menu and did basic styling

* changed XML IDs from camel case to lower snake case

* move SensorManager out of activity and into ShakeDetector

* wrote unit tests for ShakeDetector

* fixed lint errors

* changed name of constants and throw RuntimeException if creating a thread fails
Merge branch 'main' into DevMenu

Develop screen navigation and header for dev menu and fix dev menu activation (#632)

* created activity to display dev menu from context and updated package name

* start the developer menu activity and display developer menu on bottom of screen

* changed styling of dev menu to overlay current view

* updated copyright year

* only display dev menu if in debug mode

* activate dev menu on device shake or keyboard shortcut

* factor shake detection logic out into separate class

* added buttons to dev menu and did basic styling

* changed XML IDs from camel case to lower snake case

* move SensorManager out of activity and into ShakeDetector

* wrote unit tests for ShakeDetector

* fixed lint errors

* changed name of constants and throw RuntimeException if creating a thread fails

* added header and navigation to dev menu

* changed action bar title for each view

* use navigation and toolbar instead of nested layouts

* removed back arrow icon resource

* move start of license comment to new line

* add copyright statement

* moved dependencies to project build.gradle and renamed files from view to fragment

* changed nav graph action names and removed unneeded actions

* remove centered title and reformat navigation dependencies

* changed double quotes for navigationversion to single quotes

* changed navigation dependency spacing and version name

* start and stop dev menu activity on device shake

* start and stop shake listener instead of having activityStarted field

* make ShakeDetector.Listener a FunctionalInterface and remove ShakeDetector boolean field

* created dev menu manager to handle showing and hiding dev menu

* rename setVisibility method and do lazy initialization of DeveloperMenuManager instance

* create context field in DeveloperMenuManager
fixed merge conflict in Amplify.java

Create logs UI for developer menu (#659)

* created logs ui

* removed extra margin and changed placeholder text

* removed code to set text color black and changed logs search hint

* changed placeholder text for device info and logs screens
Merge branch 'main' into DevMenu

Store logs to be retrieved by developer menu (#675)

* modified AndroidLogger and AndroidLoggingPlugin to store logs for dev menu

* use a BroadcastLogger and LoggingCategory to store logs

* created devmenu package and persistent logger and plugin

* created devmenu package in androidTest

* defined getThresholdLevel for BroadcastLogger and moved persistent logger and plugin to devmenu package

* added equals and hashCode methods for LogEntry and LoggingPlugin

* changed equals and hashCode implementations in LogEntry

Create file issue UI for developer menu (#691)

* created initial file issue UI with switches

* set switch track and color

* added string resource for empty string

Display logs on the developer menu (#690)

* display logs on dev menu

* moved logic to get logs into DeveloperMenu
Renamed resources for developer menu (#693)

Create environment info UI for developer menu (#704)

* created environment info ui

* created method to make text bold

* renamed displayEnvironmentInfo method to getEnvironmentInfo

Implement developer menu file issue functionality (#700)

* created initial file issue UI with switches

* set switch track and color

* added string resource for empty string

* implemented file issue functionality

* changed file issue warning message

* removed warning label from file issue text
Merge branch 'main' into DevMenu
display environment info on dev menu
made environment info section titles italic when filing an issue
removed unnecessary casts inside file issue fragment
changed JSONException to AmplifyException
factored out logic to read JSON resource into Resources class
update comment for method to get developer environment info
added RawRes annotation to resource ID and loop through categories to get plugin versions
added import statement for NotFoundException to Resources
made Amplify.CATEGORIES public and immutable
iterate through Amplify.CATEGORIES to get plugin versions
made CATEGORIES field private and added getCategoriesMap method

Search the logs on the developer menu (#727)

* added search functionality to dev menu logs screen

* added animation for displaying logs search results

* factored out search logs functionality into a method and hide soft input keyboard when searching logs

* removed code to hide soft keyboard when searching logs

* replaced EditText with SearchView for searching logs

* add newline at end of dev_menu_styles

* update comment for searching the logs

* fixed import order in DeveloperMenu
Merge branch 'main' into DevMenu
Merge branch 'main' into DevMenu

Remove logs from issue body on developer menu (#746)

* remove code to include logs in GitHub issue

* add back code to optionally includeLogs in createIssueBody method
Merge branch 'main' into DevMenu
fixed lint error and updated rxjava imports in ShakeDetectorTest

timeline.bodyText: Don't know if it's worth changing now but was it discussed whether this would make more sense in the logging package vs. under dev menu?
timeline.author: TrekSoft
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,100 @@
+/*

+package com.amplifyframework.devmenu;

replies.bodyText: In the PR to store logs for the developer menu, Jameson left a comment about this: "One could argue either way. I'd say devmenu, since its the only consumer we currently expect for the plugin. If we find another use for it, we can always move it back to the more general location, later."
replies.author: eeatonaws
